review.title: Great location and knowledgeable staff

review.title: Clean hotel by Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Clean, small room. Noisy upstairs neighbors. Could hear outside noise. Very convenient to Fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Close to all main attractions!
review.reviewText: Easy check in. Super friendly staff. The room upheld it's expectations with cleanliness and comfort. Like many other reviews stated below, this is a noisy location. I personally didn't mind - if anything it's what I expected from a "city" atmosphere. The locations was amazing! Yes, you'll have to pay for valet parking even as a guest, but it's the same cost if one were to park anywhere in the city. This location is literally a 5 minute walk anywhere to Pier 39 or to Ghirardelli Square (and I walked with a toddler). Awesome experience and I'm thankful for the helpful and friendly staff. They're amazing!

review.title: It was nice being so close to stuff
review.reviewText: We were close enough to walk to most of the things we wanted to see. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast cafe was nice and the staff there was great.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to many things we wanted to see
review.negativeRemarks: In room fridge with freezer, microwave in the room and hot chocolate option instead of only coffee in the rooms.

review.reviewText: The valet and front desk staff were just amazing.  They were helpful and very friendly. The rooms were big and clean. Great location too. Overall we had a great time in SF thanks to the hardworking folks at the Courtyard.

review.title: Courtyard Marriott  fisherman's  Wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel location was absolutely  perfect. Walking distance to all piers.  Staff was very nice including the cleaning lady.  I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

review.title: Nice hotel at Fisherman's Wharf

review.title: Good Location

review.title: Friendly

review.title: Good location

review.title: Nice and Clean but noisy
review.reviewText: The Hotel was clean and comfortable and located in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf.  Due to the crowed noise all hours of the day and night you would think that the hotel would invest in some double pane exterior window but no.  If your room is located facing the inner courtyard then won't get a quiet nights sleep.  Other than that it was a good stay.

review.title: Nice hotel in close to many attractions
review.reviewText: Nothing in SanFran is inexpensive---including this hotel.  However the pluses are the location, the valet parking, and the ease of transportation from that location i.e. the Muni, cable cars, etc. We didn't want to worry about driving our car in the city, nor did we want to worry about parking it somewhere.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very clean, and the staff was very friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: They need something better than their 'Bistro' for food in the hotel.  They don't offer breakfast and what they do have is overpriced.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf has lots of shops, restaurants, and live music.  It's lively.  The Cable care yard is nor far away so it's easy to get tickets.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: We spent a week in san francisco and were very happy with the choice of hotels. Fantastic location being close to the water and other main attractions in the city. Most things were within walking distance. The staff was very personable, knowledgeable, friendly and extremely acommodating.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and staff. The rooms were very comfortable and clean.
review.negativeRemarks: They could provide coffee/tea throughout the day.
review.locationRemarks: One block from Fisherman's wharf and the embarcadero. The Coit tower, Lombard Street, Chinatown, Trolleys were all within walking distance.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Just returned from SF, stayed at the Courtyard for 3 nights, 4 days. Very close to Fisherman's wharf, pier 33 for Alcatraz, and close to a main trolley station and buses/tram to different parts of San Francisco. The hotel was nice, stayed on the 4th floor that was quiet and large. Our window faced the parking garage but surprisingly did not interfere with our routine. The staff was friendly and helpful, pointing out places we should avoid late at night and how to get around. Breakfast selection was limited but seriously, there are a ton of places you could go for breakfast and if you're on the run (like for a tour), it's easy to grab and go. Free wifi definitely came in handy, but they have computers and printers which helped to print boarding passes and vouchers. Would stay there again!
review.positiveRemarks: Location, helpful and friendly staff, cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: If I had to pick one thing, so minute but maybe update shower heads.
review.locationRemarks: Connected to an In and Out. Starbucks close by. Around the corner is fisherman's wharf with tons of restaurants and fast food joints.

review.reviewText: Really great location! Very clean. Staff was very helpful.

review.title: Old Dirty Furniture
review.reviewText: Not what I expected for the price.  Furniture was dirty and beat up. Very disgusted with Marriott.
review.locationRemarks: Good location.

review.title: Convenient location on Fishermans Wharf
review.reviewText: Great launching point for our vacation, we drove to Carmel, Muir Woods, Big Sur.
review.negativeRemarks: The only negative was that we were traveling with ederly family and the tub was slippery.  We requested a mat for the tub but one was not available.
review.locationRemarks: This would take to much time.  There is so much to do.

review.title: Upscale Hotel without the cost!
review.reviewText: Staff was warm efficient and welcoming upon our arrival. The room was spacious with TV, desk, wifi, hair dryer and ample amenities. Walking distance to any type or style of restaurant you would want to enjoy. Public transportation was also located near by. We had a wonderful visit. Will definitely return.

review.title: Great location and a large clean comfortable room.
review.reviewText: Stayed in two rooms for one night in San Francisco.  Rooms were very large and nicely finished, much nicer than some of the other hotels we have stayed at in the area.  Nice front desk staff and a perfect location in the heart of tourist mayhem.   Sound insulation was great and room was very quiet despite being in a heavy traffic area.  Water was literally a couple of blocks away.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Ghirardelli square, shopping, and the famous Fisherman's wharf piers.  Also close to Lombard street, and a short walk from Little Italy.

review.title: Adequate but overpriced hotel
review.reviewText: For the pricing, would expect more from this hotel; Parking rates misquoted by Expedia-$38/d now. Breakfast area is hard to find and too small, tho' staff there is very pleasant, (but overwhelmed). Internet was not working well-I gave up on it.  As with most hotels, no place to hang things, esp in the bathrooms.
review.negativeRemarks: For the price, should offer breakfast at least. Recommend increasing hours and options of dining in the cafe. Signs to find it, also! Improve internet
review.locationRemarks: Location on the wharf is nice. Many things to do in the area for all ages.

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Hotel is great just needs a bigger tv the rest of it is great.
review.locationRemarks: Everything.

review.reviewText:
Very convenient location just out of the way of the FIsherman's Wharf crowds.
The hotel appears to be of an older generation, but it has been renovated to generally meet current CY standards
Rooms were well sound-proofed
The hotel staff was friendly.  The concierge (Mr. Hom?), in particular, was always eager to make suggestions and provide assistance
review.negativeRemarks:
Fan coil HVAC units under the windows are noisy and hard to regulate
Case goods beginning to show some signs of wear.

review.reviewText: It's just an ok place. May not come back again............

review.title: Good location.  No Surprises.
review.reviewText: The Hotel is exactly what you would expect from a Marriot Courtyard.  It is clean.  Staff is friendly and amenities are good.  The location is very good if you are wanting to be in the Fisherman's Wharf area, but that's the thing...the Wharf area is touristy and there are often street people and homeless folks in the neighboring alley.  Otherwise location is ideal.  Very very close to Streetcar stop.  Very close to In and Out Burger and close to Cannery and tourist shops (and traps).   But you have to know that you are staying in a very touristy and often cheesy part of the city.  The hotel is fine and actually can be a small oasis in the touristy area.  I would recommend it to anyone with the caveat about the location and local flavor and environment.
review.positiveRemarks: Despite the homeless and occasional unsavory people nearby I felt the location was the best feature.  (Proximity to Streetcars, restauranst, etc)
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, streetcars,  tourist attractions:  Subway, In and Out Burger, Cioppinos Italian restaurant,  Wax Museum,  Tourist shops.

review.title: decent place to stay
review.reviewText: Conveniently located near shopping, restaurants and other attractions. The rooms were fairly good-sized.

review.title: Love the location, nice staff
review.reviewText: Loved the location. Easy to walk to many places-easy walk to Pier 39 and Alcatraz pier. Walgreens nearby to buy cases of water and a frig in the room to keep cold. Staff was very friendly. Concierge, Edward, takes his job very seriously to recommend attractions, tours, etc.-anything for he guests. Front desk staff was very helpful and friendly-always a warm hello when we returned. We arrived early and they store our luggage until the room was ready. Beds were comfortable. We were staying a week and they gave us a room with a patio, unfortunately it rained all week to enjoy, but a very nice extended gesture.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to walk to the piers, Ghirardelli Square, look at ships, lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Easy place to walk to board the big bus/grayline.

review.title: Great place to stay in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: We checked in for a three night's stay, celebrating a milestone birthday and could not have been more pleased with our choice of hotels. The hotel was super clean, modern and very inviting not to mention in a great location! Lots of restaurant choices within very close walking distance, and Pier 39 only about a 10 minute walk away. The staff made our stay even better, always with a smile and pleasant greeting each time we saw them and always offering assistance for anything we might need. Their customer service and attitude was second to none and made us feel very welcome. We would highly recommend this property as it exceeded all our expectations.
review.positiveRemarks:
Property was clean and modern-Staff was professional and friendly-Location was awesome
Amenities were very good-Rooms were spacious and very clean
review.locationRemarks: 10 minutes to Pier 39, right around the corner from a huge Walgreens for anything you may have forgotten and Starbucks a 5 minute walk away!

review.reviewText:
Not a bad place to stay, good

review.title: Nice hotel close to the wharf

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: The location of hotel is wonderful, in the heart of Fishermans Wharf.  We were happy to park our car and walk the city.  Driving is quite difficult and time consuming.  We easily walked to the Exploratorium and Alcatraz departures (30 minute walk).  There were plenty of places to eat and the cable car starting point is a block away.  Ghiradelli is a couple blocks away along with the Maritime Museum and Hyde Pier where we toured ships.  The parking garage next door was a bit noisy in the early evening but nothing serious.  Hotel was clean and comfortable and easy to locate.

review.title: Great location in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a great find in the Fisherman's Wharf area. Not a lot of frills, but what you do get is very well done.
The staff was very friendly and eager to help. The room was large and very comfortable.
No swimming pool and no free breakfast, but it is very close to a lot of activities and shops.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is very important and this hotel was in a great place to enjoy the city.
review.negativeRemarks: There were some small problems. One ice machine was not working, but the others were available. Minor stuff.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is right in Fisherman's Wharf with 5 minutes walking to Pier 39 and another 5 minutes to Pier 33 (Alcatraz departures). Lots of shopping!

review.title: Thank YOU!
review.reviewText: I took my two young children to San Francisco during Fleet Week. Upon arrival, the Valet staff was very friendly and accommodating. I have a large truck that would not fit in their regular parking garage.  They were kind enough to specially park my truck in their warehouse area. I had the best parking in the entire Hotel:-) They helped us with our bags on numerous occasions during our stay...Thanks guys! The Hotel staff was also very friendly, helpful and informative about the local surroundings. The room was clean and comfortable with a pretty good view. My daughter had cut her finger but the little store did not have any first aid kits or band-aids. When I had informed the staff of what had happened, they immediately supplied me with disinfectant wipes, ointment and band-aids. My daughter went from distraught and in pain back to smiles and laughter in no time...Thank you staff for all of your help, kindness and friendliness. We will be returning soon!
review.positiveRemarks: The staff, the locale (proximity to restaurants, bars and entertainment), the room comfort and painless check-in/out
review.negativeRemarks: Not much if anything at all. There's no pool but with a swim beach a block away, it didn't matter

review.reviewText:
We arrived early and they nicely got into our room hours early.  Clean, and well maintained.  The staff was helpful with advice about an excursion that we were going to do.  No complaints --however 2 washers and 2 dryers in not enough for a property this size.  

I would stay here again, as you are 10 seconds away from the action.  Before I booked I read about other's complaints about road noise, and I do not agree.  However, I was woken up by the gym's barbells being dropped on the floor very early in the morning -so, just don't get that room.

The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  We even forgot a few items in the room which they are shipping to us at no charge.  I will definitely stay there again!

The location cannot be beat - the cable cars, Ghirardelli Square, and Pier 39 are just a short walk, and it's still a quiet stay despite being in close proximity to so many tourist attractions and restaurants. They also offer valet service and have an Avis right next door if you need to rent a car. The concierge was wonderful too.

managementResponses.response: We appreciate the positive feedback that the Staff provided a clean, comfortable and friendly experience. Our guest rooms are all equipped with hair dryers. I am sorry your rooms seemed to be missing this item. We will be sure to follow up with our team. We are concerned about the noise encounter adjacent to the Hotel in the parking garage structure. We believe this might be an isolated incident but regardless will notify Ace Parking whom manages the parking garage. There is twenty four hour security patrol in the complex. We understand your frustration and apologize for the incident. Thank you for staying with us and sharing your experience.

However, with the noisy parking garage next to our room and no hair dryer in the rooms, I would most likely stay at either the Hyatt or Holiday Inn by Fisherman's Wharf. They have been just as comfy and clean in our previous visits to SF.

review.title: nice hotel; very close to fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText:
we stayed for three nights and everything was great. the hotel room was clean and the bathroom was very modern and clean. the room was a little small for 4 adults, but manageable. the beds were large and comfortable and there was a small desk area with a chair.
the hotel was 1/2 block from fisherman's wharf and walking distance to many sites. we were there for three days and never used our car. the staff was extremely helpful with excursions, directions and recommendations. the small restaurant in the hotel had breakfast and lunch- there is a fee for both. a continental breakfast would have been great!
review.locationRemarks: alcatraz was a great 1/2 day excursion. the city big bus tour was very good- a bit long at almost 3 hours.

managementResponses.response: We are pleased to know the staff was attentive and took great care of you. The staff offered room transferred which I declined for my convenience.  Otherwise, the hotel is very accessible and clean, and staff are very warm and welcoming.

managementResponses.response: We appreciate your comments and concerns. We truly care about our guests comfort. We are sorry to hear that your stay at our establishment did not meet your expectations. We have every desire to address the comments regarding the noise generated inside the hotel. Our location does not typically experience negative feedback regarding noise from within our building. We want to make every effort to address concerns of this nature promptly. Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience. Itâs our goal to retain you as a satisfied customer and hope to serve you again in the future.

review.title: Average hotel, good location, needs an upgrade
review.reviewText:
We booked at a time San Francisco was very busy, so paid an exorbitant price for what we got - but this was the same for all hotels, not just this one (2-3 times normal rates).  I'm basing this review on my expectation of what you'd normally pay - as if I based on what we actually paid, I'd be giving them 0 stars for everything.

Our room was pleasant enough - standard hotel style, everything is a bit dated but clean and tidy.  There was a small outdoor area, that was completely walled in - but I guess at least we could walk outside.  No view of anything, but the room wasn't advertised with a view so that is ok.

No onsite restaurant (but they did have a breakfast area that we didn't use) and no mini bar but there was a fridge.

The noise was terrible.  You could hear everyone walking down the corridor, every door opening and closing, ever conversation they had etc.  You could also hear continuous creaking from the room upstairs whenever they moved around their room.  This would really put me off staying here ever again, as this does affect your sleep quality.

There was a bit of noise from outside, but really not that bad - to be expected from the area, and not enough to keep you awake or wake you up (like the noise generated inside the hotel does).
review.negativeRemarks: Noise from within the hotel was terrible.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to the main Fisherman's Wharf area, easy walking distance to restaurants, Pier 39, cable cars, street cars, bus route, Walgreens, etc
