review.title: Nice hotel close to everything!
review.reviewText: Central location within walking distance to fishermans wharf, ghiradelli, pier 39.  Close to all wharf restaurants and cable car. Hotel staff knows what's going on and they greet you by name. We were so late to check in that they had to give us a suite but we had to change rooms the next day. The next morning we went down to the front desk and the morning staff knew the story and took care of everything including moving our luggage while we enjoyed the city. Would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: On the wharf close to all restaurants and ghiradelli and pier 39

review.title: Spacious by SF standards but tech letdown
review.reviewText: We tried this hotel having had some very cramped rooms near fishermans' wharf, and were pleased with a fairly spacious room, the staff were very friendly and helpful. However the tech was a letdown for California - the wifi didn't work and the TV kept having to be reset
Close to everything, quiet and comfortable...we would come back here

review.title: Great Hotel close to the Wharf
review.reviewText: We have stayed at many places in SF and enjoyed our stay at the Courtyard. It was only a block to Fisherman's Wharf which was so convenient. The rooms were nice and the bed was very comfortable. We would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Updated, clean, close to the Wharf.
review.negativeRemarks: Waited a while to get our car when leaving.
review.locationRemarks: You are a block from Fisherman's wharf and a short walk to Pier 39! There is a Maritime Museum, Ghirardelli Square, Cable Cars, Marina , SF Giants!

review.title: Convenient location.
review.reviewText: Stayed two nights, Hotel was convenient to any place in San Francisco.  Hotel staff gave us easy directions to take a short bus ride to AT&T park at a very reasonable price ($2 per person).  We also took a cab to downtown and it was still reasonable at ~ $12.  Hotel has a very convenient cafe for breakfast.  They offered a healthy continental breakfast of oatmeal, fresh fruit, and yogurt which was very satisying and the cafe staff was very friendly and helpful.  We would definitely stay here again!
review.locationRemarks: We went to a Magic show in downtown on O'Farrell St.and thoroughly enjoyed it.  AT&T Park is also convenient and fun.

review.title: Wish we spent more nights there
review.reviewText: We were only there one (last) night, but wish we had booked more night there. My sons & myself thought the room was large, very comfortable & clean. This was the last night of a series of 5 different hotels from LA to SF & my sons voted this hotel best of the 5!

review.title: Convenient location to attractions.
review.reviewText: Very nice but would like complimentary coffee/tea cafe.

review.title: Great place to stay on Fisherman's Warf
review.reviewText: Great location.  Courteous and helpful Staff.  Clean and quiet accommodations.
review.locationRemarks: Proximity to restaurants, shops, bike rentals and cable cars.

review.title: Great staff, comfortable accommodations.
review.reviewText:
From the front desk staff to the curb, every individual was pleasant and interesting, in the most friendly way.  Suggestions for outside activities always proved to be just as satisfying as promised and we couldn't have enjoyed our stay more.  The Concierges (we dealt with three) were extremely helpful and steered us in the most favorable direction.  The Housekeepers were always helpful and met our requests with enthusiasm and a smile.  The Bistro staff met us with smiles and a helpful attitude every morning.  
Please ensure the every member of the staff knows that their efforts and effectiveness did not go unnoticed, that we appreciated every contact with them, and they made our stay most enjoyable.

review.title: Great hotel near in Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Next to the parking garage where Avis and Hertz cars can be rented or returned; great staff and very helpful concierge.

review.title: very clean hotel with a great location
review.reviewText:
I reviewed many hotels before our trip to SF. This hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful.
The location can't be beat if you want to be near Fisherman's Wharf. This was my children's first visit to SF and they absolutely loved their stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was perfect for our family. Also, I am extremely picky when it comes to cleanliness. This hotel met my high standards!
review.negativeRemarks: The kids were disappointed there was no pool, but other than that it was great!
review.locationRemarks: Right on Fisherman's Wharf and just down the street from the Trolley stop.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Wharf
review.reviewText: Conveniently located, service was friendly and helpful, all in all a great stay.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Close to Fisherman's Wharf and excellent restaurants.

managementResponses.response: Thank you for giving us feedback about the fee for parking and channel programming. We offer valet parking as a convenience for our guests. The area in which the hotel is located offers public parking or metered at an hourly rate. Our price point is more cost effective and offers in and out privileges. Concerning our high definition channel programming we offer sixteen high definition channels. We apologize for the inconvenience and that our offerings are not satisfactory. We will be certain to share your comments with our Brand Leadership. We appreciate your input and thank you for sharing with us.

review.title: HD TV
review.reviewText: As much as this room cost a day, you would think that they would have all HD TV channels ????? Also Free Parking would be GREAT !!!!

review.title: Great hotel close to fishernan's wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel is really nice. What made the difference for us was the staff at Courtyard Marriott. In particular, Loni Pulotu, was far and away the nicest, most attentive person you could want helping you. He was the nicest person I met while in the San Francisco area.
review.negativeRemarks: the view was not the greatest
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's wharf has tons of little shops& restaurants-Ghiradelli Square& Pier 39 are not far away. Lombard Street is an easy walk from the hotel

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Friendly helpfull staff great location convenient to major attractions

review.title: Nice hotel close to everything.
review.reviewText: No need to rent a car in San Francisco, this hotel is close to all transportation, restaurants, shopping, tours & bike shops. The house cleaners kept giving us towels for three when we were a total of 4guests in one room but I believe this is common in California as this happened in a different city as well. The front desk was very helpful. The rooms are nicely sized with actuall 2 queen beds, pillows seemingly uncomfortable for all of us. Their breakfast menu may seem highly priced but isn't when compared to eating at local eateries, I spent double outside of hotel but get there early on weekdays they close earlier. Wish they would have a complimentary breakfast or coffee bar as the mornings are quite chilly to go & grab. Overall I would stay again and recommend to others.

review.title: Queen beds
review.reviewText: Only decent priced hotels in area with queen beds instead of doubles.
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Can walk to all wharf attractions

managementResponses.response:
Thank you staying and taking time to share your experience.We apologize that we did not honor the room type
and microwave reserved. Unfortunently there are times when we have unexpected stayovers which creates a situation where we are unable to honor the bed type. Again we apologize for this inconvenience.

review.title: It was alright....
review.reviewText: I had booked through expedia and paid for what was supposed to be a king bed room. I called the hotel ahead of time to confirm my booking and also made certain the hotel room had a bathtub and they had told me that they would have a microwave in the room for me because i had requested one ahead of time. I arrive at the hotel and there is no microwave and the room is a queen bed and a handicap shower with no tub. I am not sure what went wrong in all of this but it made the whole experience more stressful than i wanted it to be for an evening that was supposed to be comfortable. They did move us to a double queen room in order to have a tub in the bathroom and they offered us free breakfast in the cafe. That was lovely, but the experience right off the bat was overwhelming and unsatisfactory.

review.title: Noisey location
review.reviewText: Me and my husband were on a well needed relaxing trip. We have three children so out time alone is precious. The hotel was rather pricey but wanted to be able to walk around. Our room was faced toward In and Out burger where they have no control over noise. I called at 8:30 to request a different room so I could enjoy my time and they were unable to accommodate. As the night progressed it got worse at 1:30 am I called again where the staff stated they would leave a message for manager but were full and could not help us. However they would try to send security to see if they could push people along. Finally at 3 am the noise got to a level that we could sleep. Windows are single pane and cheaply put together so we heard everything.

review.title: good location and good customer service
review.reviewText: located within walking distance of tourist attractions such as ghirardelli square, fisherman's wharf and pier 39. our room was a good size and very clean. was a little bit worried about the valet service based on other reviews, but was pleasently surprised. the valet had great customer service and we did not have any issues.
review.positiveRemarks: the valet was great. they were very friendly and always had our vehicle ready for us quickly.

review.title: Excellent hotel, great location!
review.reviewText: This place is in the perfect spot in Fisherman's Wharf. Everything is close by - restaurants, shops, public transport - and only a short walk to Pier 39 and rooms have free wi-fi. It's back a block from Fisherman's Wharf, so it's not too noisy. The rooms are excellent, prices very reasonable and the staff are very helpful and friendly. We will definitely stay here again! Parking is expensive ($36 per day), but that seems the norm in San Francisco. Had a bit of a problem with noise from room above, but the staff fixed that immediately and discounted our account.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, friendly helpful staff, free Wi-Fi.
review.locationRemarks: Near Ghiardelli Square, lots of restaurants and shops nearby and public transport/cable car close too.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: If I had anything negative it would be ," I wish there Bistro hours offered more than breakfast"! There were days after being out all day it would have been nice to be able to come back to my room and order something to eat . Like a good burger , salad or fries! The fast good chains in the area were not that good! I had teenagers and it would have helped! Would have liked to eat something in my room.

review.title: Good location, bad parking.
review.reviewText: It's a nice enough hotel, and the location is tough to beat if you want access to the wharf area. A major frustration for me was the parking situation. I know a lot of people don't bring a car, but for guests that do, there should be a better option than $80 for a little over 24 hour stay...
review.locationRemarks: All of the things to do at Fisherman's Wharf are right there.

review.title: great location walking distance from the Warf
review.reviewText: Nice Accomodations but was extremely pricey for what you get. Staff was friendly and was whithin walking distance drom the warf. If driving, the options for parking was community parkimg garage for 36.00 a day or 36.00 dollars for valet. No complimentary coffee or light Breakfast in the mornings. Gym was adequate with moderately mid to old equipment. not exactly a geeat bang for your buck, but to be expected from a SF trip.Staff was extremely friendly.
Friendly and helpful staff

review.title: Clean and easy
review.reviewText: Close to everything and clean. We had a good experience here. Bistro leaves much to be desired. Find breakfast/coffee elsewhere

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Even though pricey than other hotels around, well worth the stay. Room was clean and staff was very friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: Personnel was Very friendly and helpful. Great Location
review.negativeRemarks: Free Continental breakfast. Internet was very slow.
review.locationRemarks: Close to cable car stop. Great restaurants.

review.title: Close to activities at the wharf!
review.reviewText: The valet service was excellent.
review.negativeRemarks: Tub was a bit mildew stained
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect to the wharf, shops, restaurants, alcatraz etc

review.title: very nice hotel, close to beach, restaurants
review.locationRemarks: close to cable car stop, golden gate bridge, and Alcatraz and transportation to downtown personnel very friendly

review.title: Watch out for valet parking
review.reviewText:
We spent 2 nights in this adequate hotel, and used valet parking for $82. Apparently they park your car some distance from the hotel, since there is no in/out privilege. We got up early (6:30 AM) for the trip back to LA. It took them 40 minutes to get my car, and then it had a flat tire!!! The front desk said there was nothing could do, they assume no liability when they take your car. I called AAA, got temp spare put on, found a tire shop, and 3 hours and $300 later we were on our way. Tire had a nail in it and couldn't be repaired, I haven't had a flat in over 15 years. They drive my car for 1 minute and get a flat.
There's a big public garage next to hotel, a little cheaper than hotel, I almost parked there instead... a $300 lesson learned.

review.title: Nice hotel close to Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Staff was VERY friendly and helpful. Our room was clean, spacious, and nice. Toilet in bathroom was kind of weird (stuck out from the wall) but everything else was just fine. We enjoyed our stay. Room was clean (important to us) and quiet. Too bad no complimentary breakfast! Had to pay for parking ($36 per day) which was a bummer, but expected in San Fran. Overall, this hotel is close to everything, safe, and clean. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, comfortable, and close to all major San Francisco attractions.
review.negativeRemarks: Free continental breakfast would be an added plus. Also, soda machines on the floors rather than having to go to the "Market Place" downstairs.
review.locationRemarks: A couple of blocks from Fisherman's Wharf. We walked to our Alcatraz ferry on Pier 33 (only took 15 minutes). Cable car pick up close by.

review.title: Good location.
review.reviewText: Chose this rather pricey hotel for it's location to Fisherman's Wharf. Two day stay. Walked to all the major attractions & shopping. Hotel was very nice but pricey. $36/day for parking is a bit too much, but is probably in line with other hotels with comparable location.
review.locationRemarks: Walked to all the food places . Scomas on Fishermans Wharf for dinner - Excellent! Alliotos on Pier 39 for dinner - very good. Pompeii Grill for lu

review.title: Location is really all this place had going for it
review.reviewText:
High speed internet was slow and unusable. No pool. No continental breakfast. No room service. Reserved room with one king bed and got room with two fulls. They couldn't switch us, so we slept in separate beds the whole time. No shuttle to/from the airport.

I would definitely NOT stay here again.

review.title: Great location - suitable for all generations.
review.reviewText: Nice lobby area but rooms were nothing special. However, for the price you get a great location.
review.positiveRemarks: Location - minutes from cable cars, wharf, shops and restaurants. Mere seconds from Segway and bike hire!
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms dark and air con louder than usual.
review.locationRemarks: Great!

review.title: Courtyard San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf.
review.reviewText: If you want to be in the thick of the action around the wharf area then this is extremely convenient.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to fisherman's wharf and surrounds.

review.title: Nice hotel close to attractions
review.reviewText: Easy to access tours and public transportation from this location. The breakfast cafe was fast and efficient even when crowded. Hotel staff was knowledgeable about the area and services, attractions and very helpful. Rooms were clean. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great location...easy to walk everywhere!
review.reviewText: Couldn't have picked a better place to start our 25th Anniversary Celebration! Loved our whole San Fran experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, very comfortable bed and very friendly staff
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, eating, sightseeing all within walking distance. So many things just steps away from this hotel.

review.title: Courtyard of Marriott near fisherman's wharf
review.reviewText: The hotel location is only about three blocks from pier 39, two blocks from geriadelli square and grocery/walgreens is just a few steps from the hotel. There were lots of restaurants around including a Thai restaurant, in and out burger, pizza place, and subway. The hotel itself has the most courteous and helpful staff especially this Filipino guy that works at their breakfast bistro....I think his name is Ernesto. The room was clean and we didn't have any issue of any noises that the other reviewers stated.
review.positiveRemarks: Room was clean. Location is great. Staff are very helpful and courteous.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, fishing, sightseeing, dining.

review.title: Good location but prict for what it is
review.reviewText: Convenient location for the pier and the trams. Clean and comfortable but pricy for the standard it is and the lack of an inclusive breakfast.

review.title: Great Location at Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Apart from it being a great central location for anyone planning on spending time at Fisherman's Wharf, the room was great. Roomy and with a small sofa. Staff was also excellent. I was traveling from L.A. and running behind schedule. Called ahead to let them know I was arriving late and it was not problem. I was having a minor issue with my vehicle, and spoke to the valet staff. They got management for me and came up with a plan to reassure me, things would be okay, and they were. Everything about the hotel was great. I have already recommended it to others. I have stayed at a few different place here before, looking for the best deals, but I have found my spot. And the overnight valet parking is only $36 per night. It was over $60 at other places in the area.
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite thing about the hotel is the location. It is only about a block away from Scomas, Buena Vista, Cable Car and a few blocks to Pier 39
review.negativeRemarks: If the hotel had an ATM inside and maybe longer hours at it's Bistro, but there is an ATM and In-N-Out in the plaza outside & other places to eat near
review.locationRemarks: Within a block: Scoma's, Buena Vista Cafe (Irish Coffee), In-N-Out, shops, tour bus stop, Cable Car, various restaurants. Within a few blks: Pier39

review.title: People/Street Noise woke us up both nights
review.reviewText:
I had read a ton of reviews on line prior to booking so I was disappointed that I wasn't aware of the location near a bar. Our room was street side (which wasn't bad in terms of car noise) but the bar across the street closed at 1:30 Friday and Sat night and hoards of young people spilled into the street and created quite a scene. Both nights I got up to watch and was concerned that it would be easy for a fight to break out - I wondered how secure the hotel lobby was. The 2nd night, after I went back to bed, I heard a cop siren so I think someone must have called them. I was envious of the other street of hotels (North Point) that had hotel after hotel on it. I assume those streets are quieter in the middle of the night.
The location is very close to the Wharf and I'm not sure folks with a room facing the back side of the hotel would have heard anything so other guests might not be as affected as we were. We checked in relatively late because we had arrived too early and went sight seeing all day.
The accommodations were fine - the bath towels were a bit thin and rough. The staff was nice. With so many hotels to choose from in the area, I wouldn't stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, on site work out facility and a quick and easy place to eat breakfast (Starbucks coffee a plus)
review.negativeRemarks: You need to hire security on Fri/Sat nights to make sure the crowds move along and don't create a disturbance in front of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Everything to do with the Wharf is right at your door step.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location for access to usher mans wharf. Close transport

review.title: Girls Trip
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a fabulous location. Close to everything.

review.title: Good to use just to sleep in
review.reviewText: Hotel is basic and I guess overpriced for what it offers

review.title: clean but not as upscale as pictured
review.reviewText: The staff at the hotel was gracious and professional. The rooms were clean. However, the hotel was not as upscale as the photos suggested. The ceilings were at most eight feet high. There was no refrigerator in the room.

review.title: Group of Friends!
review.reviewText:
The location is perfect for all activities at the Wharf, and is one block from the Powell-Hyde cable car. Walking distance to North Beach (Italian area), and to hike up Telegraph hill to Coit tower. Bike Rental around corner from lobby. Highly recommend biking to GG Bridge. The rooms are spacious, clean, comfy beds & linens, mini fridge and coffee maker. Walgreens 1 block away for snacks, drinks, etc.

From airport take BART to Embarcadero Station, then F-Line Street car to Beach Street (in front of Walgreens) $10. Or arrange transport thru Hotel $14/pp/direction.

Dining w/in 2 blocks: Scoma or McCormicks (seafood & ex sunset view), Cioppino's, Waterfront Cafe (pastries coffee). Hotel cafe good breakfast

Live Jazz/blues/funk/dance floor at the Boom Boom Room (cab ride to Filmore & Geary
review.negativeRemarks: Can't use the stairwells, except to exit. Not a fan of elevators and this hotel has only 4 floors

review.title: Great place to stay in SF.
review.reviewText: It was very clean and comfortable. It is located in a nice area of San Francisco The people that work there where super helpful and friendly especially the older gentalman that greets you. Overall a great place to stay and we would definitely come back.
review.locationRemarks: Nice area

review.title: Great location if you don't need a car
review.reviewText:
Great location. Within a walking distance to Pier 39 (Fisherman Wharf) and Ghirardelli , which is a tourist area. There are places where you can rent a bike if you are into biking across the Golden gate bridge. No need to rent a car if you stay at this hotel. Also, you can take cable car about 3 blocks away to downtown/union square for shopping. Walking to North beach where many Italian restaurants, Coit Tower and Washington Square park located; and China town is do-able or you can take a public transportation (I believe it's called Muni 30).
Customer service is great and room is standard and clean. I believe it has been remodeled recently. It doesn't have a big lobby and breakfast is not included during my stay. However, you can always go to restaurants nearby.

review.title: Great place to stay!!
review.reviewText: Nice place to stay if visiting SF. Walking distance to all the attractions on the Warf. Nice ,clean, and comfortable hotel. It is worth paying a little more for a place that is nice to stay in. I recommend this establishment to anyone. Had family staying down the street in a nice hotel however I noticed this hotel was roomier. Nice staff working here also...

review.title: Recommend
review.reviewText: Great location frienly staff would recommend to family and friends
review.locationRemarks: Liked the location close to cable train and cable car nice walk to fishermans wharf.

review.title: San Francisco amazing Location.
review.reviewText: Fantastic. In the best spot for SF. Easy access to walk all over the Bay Area and catch public transport.
review.negativeRemarks: Only two doubles in each room.
review.locationRemarks: In the best place for the price range our family was looking for.

review.title: great for city trip, convinient for families.
review.reviewText: Great location, easy check in, friendly staff, good room size.

review.title: A great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText:
Pros: clean rooms, good customer service, all what you would need from a great hotel

Cons ; no breakfast!!, price gauching on parking amenities.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: Great hotel by Pier 39
review.reviewText:
It was overall an exceptional experience. The only problem we had was with our television. Our children were with us on this trip and the kids channels were not working. This was somewhat of a problem for our babysitter while my husband and I were out on the town.
By morning the the problem was fixed. Besides that I would give this hotel high marks and would definitely stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location, walking distance to everything

review.title: Nice hotel for a jumping off point!
review.reviewText: The hotel is situated in a good area for anyone visiting San Francisco. There is not a lounge, but there are plenty of options nearby.
review.locationRemarks: Great Jumping off point

review.title: not the cleanest hotel we have stayed at.
review.reviewText:
on first night of stay found a roach in bath room and reported it to hotel staff
we were not very happy.also we ate at the breakfast room and are the milk was sour after that
we ate elseware.
review.locationRemarks: great for fishermens wharf area.

review.title: Best Fisherman's Wharf Hotel To Stay
review.reviewText: Hotel is perfectly located in Fisherman's Wharf area. The rooms and staff were excellent. They went out of their way to give recommendations on the best restaurants and how to get around.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for anyone visiting San Francisco. In the heart of Fisherman's Wharf and one block from a cable car station and old time trains.

review.title: Great for business or vacation
review.reviewText: Great location on Fisherman's Wharf that provided great service and a comfy nights rest.

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText:
Stayed six days. Booked it for the rate and being on the Wharf. Family of four, including two 13 year old boys. Two queen beds, but a good amount of space such that we never felt cramped. Location was fine... walked everywhere or took public transportation when needed. Lobby staff was always present, pleasant and sincerely helpful. Stay at many hotels for work and pleasure and both my wife and I commented that the hotel (and people) provided a better than expected experience. Would recommend.
Criticisms are few... elevators are so slow you almost always take the stairs, counter people at the in-house restaurant are very sweet but also slow.
review.locationRemarks: great

review.title: Our San Francisco Home Away From Home
review.reviewText: Phil, the valet, was immensely helpful with getting our rental car filled with gas and returned after a 13 hour drive up the coast. Marc was very helpful with the details of our stay. The lobby was attractive, there was complimentary coffee and newspapers in the morning, and the location (right between Ghirardelli Square and Pier 39) was ideal. We have found our San Francisco Hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: The touchscreen information board in the lobby, the cool, large, well lit bathroom, and the comfy bed.
review.negativeRemarks: Being charged for 2 days of valet parking when arriving at 8pm and leaving at 7am the next morning.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect.

review.title: Perfect location to enjoy San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel was our bed. Thats all we expected. It was very convenient to all public transportation as well as local attractions. The room was made ready every day by noon. The breakfast program was adequate but we found a local organic place that we loved. Our room at the end of the hall was above a fastfood restaurant and could be noisy but we were usually so exhausted we had little issues.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for public transportation and Fishersman's Wharf, Pier 39 and 41.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff. Fantastic location near Fisherman's Warf. Great place to stay for familes with kids.

review.title: Great hotel...Great location!
review.reviewText: Hotel was fantastic! My family had a wonderful time...I would stay there again.

review.title: stingy pad
review.reviewText: No breakfast?? Really??? The rooms are nice, but for the price' at least offer me a bagel

review.title: Great hotel for sightseers.
review.reviewText: The hotel was fantastic. It was located steps from Fisherman's Wharf, was clean and comfortable and we enjoyed our stay.
review.locationRemarks: The location was excellent. It was steps from major attractions at Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Great location - good for exploring the city. Close to cable cars & fisherman's wharf. Comfortable beds & fairly spacious room. Parking is very expensive -$36/day!

review.title: Bad service
review.reviewText: The service was terrible. When we checked in, they gave us keys to a room that was already occupied and weren't even apologetic about it. Parking is ridiculous there so if you're driving be prepared to pay out the nose for parking.

review.title: I loved this hotel!
review.reviewText: Great little hotel. Perfect location. The staff of the Marriot Courtyard Fisherman's Wharf were friendly, helpful, informative and very pleasant. The rooms were large and the beds and pillows were fabulous! The little breakfast spot was perfect. They were so accomodating to whatever you wanted!
review.negativeRemarks: I wish we could have stayed another night
review.locationRemarks: Short walk to Cable cars!

review.title: Stay here!
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, modern & clean rooms, reasonably priced, close to everything in San Francisco. The staff at this hotel gets a two thumbs up -- everyone went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. Be sure to visit Alcatrez & do the self guided tour!
review.locationRemarks: One block back from Fisherman's Wharf area

review.title: ALL YOU COULD ASK FOR . . .
review.reviewText: This hotel is all that you can ask for--friendly staff, lovely rooms and bedding, excellent location, service with a smile, etc.
review.locationRemarks: Only a short walk from lots of good stuff!

review.title: Nice Place
review.reviewText: Check in was easy. Room was nice and kept clean. All staff at hotel were friendly and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: A bit of street noise on Friday and Saturday nights

review.title: good experience!!
review.reviewText: clean and comfortable; always prompt help from the front desk. Easy location-wise to get to trolleys and cable cars. Very good experience.

review.title: San Francisco visit.
review.reviewText:
Most of staff were wonderful......a couple of front desk staff (gentlemen) during late afternoon and evening were less than cordial and helpful.
They did not log in a wake up call for one morning and did not put much effort into getting us taxi service.
Otherwise, the day staff and housekeeping groups were terrific.
review.negativeRemarks: Bistro prices were a bit steep for quality and quantity of offerings
review.locationRemarks: very convenient for our itinerary. Close to action.

review.title: 3/21/12 Bestwestern stay
review.reviewText: My experience at Garberville's Best Western was very enjoyable. Our room was cozy and eligant, staff was friendly and professional, and their hot continential breakfast was the best I've ever had at any hotel. I recommend this hotel to anyone that is traveling along hwy 101 in California.

review.title: Great location for price
review.reviewText: The location was excellent. Relative to other hotels in the area, it was also the best price for the quality.
review.negativeRemarks: Not a luxury hotel, but still nice
review.locationRemarks: perfect

review.title: Great location !
review.reviewText:
My husband and I are runners, we wanted to stay close to the water and the parks, - for this reason, the location was perfect. There are also many restaurants in walking distance and the cable car is around the corner.

We stayed for 3 nights and were very happy with our selection.
Very friendly and accommodating staff. Exellent location! The room and the hotel was very clean.
We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

We also enjoyed the fresh food for breakfast at the bistro.

review.title: Best location and good staff.
review.reviewText: Best location and good staff. Easy to to to everywhere. The staff was very helpful.

review.title: Will be back
review.reviewText: Staff was great. Room was exactly how expected. The location was perfect for walking the sites near the Wharf.

review.title: Don't agree with 2 rating
review.reviewText: There was nothing to fault the Courtyard by Marriott. It served its purpose: to give us a bd for three nights in rooms which were clean and very comfortable. The staff were very helpful. Our only criticism was at breakfast where the server behind the counter could barely understand English and each day she got very confused about our requests - not helpful early in the morning when you want a good start to the day. Also the counter service a bit rudimentary with paper cups and plates. Breakfast could have been a much more memorable occasion in more conducive surroundings. A shame - the rest excellent, particularly convenient for transport links.

review.title: Great Hotel!!!
review.reviewText:
This is a great hotel and it's close to everythying. I stayed five days and will
book it again.
review.locationRemarks: Fisherman's Wharf area

review.title: I would be back
review.reviewText: a friendly service. according with its category

review.title: Great Location to Explore San Francisco
review.reviewText: The location can not be beat. It is in the heart of the Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: San Francisco
review.reviewText: Fantastic City

review.title: Big Room
review.reviewText:
We were VERY IMPRESSED with the size of the hotel room. I was amazed on how big the bathroom was, and the decor was eye-catching. I'm not used to being in a bathroom where I don't feel crowded. It was a nice feeling. We were very comfortable with the size of the rest of the room as well.

The view...well, there was none. Our view was the car garage next door. But, that was OK with us, since we weren't there most of the day anyway.

To answer you question, yes, we would stay there again without any hesitation.

review.title: Just the right location
review.reviewText:
It was the perfect location for seafood at the Fisherman's Wharf, the cable car rides, and the F-line street car.

We had a quiet room facing the alley. The mattress was comfortable so we were able to rest up after long days touring the city.

The staff was friendly. We had a great recommendation from Edward at the concierge for seafood at Pompei Grotto, which is right behind the hotel.

review.title: Cozy hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was great, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Wish the hotel had a restaurant and maybe a Spa but other than that it was great! Close to everything so choices were unlimited.

review.title: Highly recommend
review.reviewText: Great location and very nice hotel.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Staff were absolutely wonderful!

review.title: ok place near FW
review.reviewText: good location near wharf - but noisy. bring tour information as only a screen in lobby for those wanting tourist information.

review.title: Courtyard Marriott at Fisherman's Wharf - excellent location
review.reviewText: The best thing about this hotel is the location - it's right in the middle of the Fisherman's Wharf area with lots of shops & restaurants around. Also about 1 block from the cable car (but get there very early otherwise you'll have greater than a 1 hr wait time). Also conveniently located near Ghiradelli Square where you can pick up bus tours. Hotel staff was very helpful...rooms were great. Only down side was no fridge/microwave in room.

review.title: Recommended with reservations
review.reviewText:
This hotel is clean, the staff is extremely helpful and nice but we were disappointed in several aspects of the hotel.

The hotel does not have room service. This is very disappointing. How do you not provide room service to your guests?

The hotel does not have a pool. The boys wanted to go swimming (even though it was 50+ degrees outside) and didn't understand why the hotel didn't have an indoor or heated outdoor pool like the Embassy Suites.

The Bistro had very limited selection of breakfast foods. The muffins tasted like feet and the help was not so helpful.

The valet and conceirge went out of their way to hail us a taxi in the rain. They literally had to run down the street and flag a taxi in the middle of the very busy intersection. When we left the valet stood out in the street so I could make a left onto a very busy Beach Street.

If room service, a pool and crappy breakfast do not bother you...then this is the hotel for you. It is clean, the staff is very nice and the maids accommodate your requests with a smile.

review.title: perfect choice
review.reviewText: This hotel is in the perfect location for visiting fishermen's wharf. There is also easy access to the rest of the city either on foot or by public transportaion. The hotel was clean, the room spatious, bed comfortable, bathroom brand new, and the staff, friendly and anxious to be of assistance. Have stayed in other similar brand hotels in SF but would choose to return here.

review.title: Best hotel at the Wharf
review.reviewText:
Valet was cheapest I could find anywhere in San Francisco, $36.00 a day will in/out rights. One valet in particular was very polite and helpful and had our car ready at 5 am when we needed it to leave even though valet wasn't officaly
open yet for the day. Many name brand eateries and local places within a block walking distance. No complaints what so ever about this hotel. Would definetly stay again.

review.title: Walking distance to major attractions & restaurants!
review.reviewText: Our son and family accompanied us. Would like to have had connecting rooms. Did not see how to request that when making reservations on Expedia. They were able to have us across the hall from each other. Very quiet, polite friendly staff. Walgreens, Starbucks, cable car turn around, fast food choices and major Fisherman's Whart attractions within a comfortable walking distance. Be sure to "Ride the Duck" which also was just a couple blocks way away. Knew ahead of time about the $36 parking fee, but don't understand why. They offer complimentary coffe and OJ in the morning. Would stay here again.

review.title: San Fran wharf
review.reviewText: Spring break - a great time

review.title: Great hotel in a great location!
review.reviewText: If I were to return to Fishermans Wharf in San Francisco, this is the hotel I would use. It was very clean, the staff were all so nice and it was in a great location to visit Fishermans Wharf. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit and my "home-away-from-home"!

review.title: Attentive, if a little overbearing service!
review.reviewText:
When we checked in, all I had to do was give them my name and a credit card for the valet (which is not cheap-they really should just charge more a night and have complementary valet) and we headed up to the room. Seamless check-in. The room was clean and comfortable. I'll never understand why housekeeping gets in a bind if you don't let them clean the room. We were there 2 nights-I don't need the bed made in between.

My only beef with the room was the location in the hotel. We were on the alley side, above H00ters and across from the parking garage. There was a little street noise-not enough to bother me, but light sleepers might have a problem with it.

All in all, a great room at a decent price, and nicely located close to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghiradelli Square. It's also a nice walk down the waterfront to Pier 33 and the Alcatraz tour, or up the hill to North Beach.

review.title: Walk to Chinatown, the Wharf, bars, great stay.
review.reviewText: We used the cable car, walked to Chinatown for breakfast everyday, drank at the FIddler's Green pub across the street. Walked to Ghiradelli to have sundaes. Even bought medicine at Walgreens downstairs. Staff is curteous and drank free coffee every morning. Beds were soft.

review.title: Cannot recommend, would not go back
review.reviewText:
Air Conditioner - Heating System: Malfunctioned (kicking back and forth between heating and cooling cycle all night - which caused the room being either too hot or freezing).
Complained the next morning but nothing was fixed for the second night.

All elevators malfunctioend for a number of hours.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: What a great jump off point to the sights of Fisherman's Wharf and all the other attractions of San Francisco

review.title: Over rated, over priced, 5 star price, 1 star service.
review.reviewText: This is a very average room in a very nice area, front desk clerk had a nasty attitude and was not happy to be there. Location was great hotel was not.

review.title: Awesome location and great service
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Within walking distance to just about everything including the Hyde-Powell cable car turnaround, Pier 39, and food. Every member of the hotel staff we came into contact with were extremely courteous and Edward was very helpful in restaurant recommendations. (Joanies Happy Days Diner serves an awesome breakfast which is only a block away. We ate there every morning). Our room was very neat and clean. I recommend requesting one with a patio, as this was a great place to relax every evening. This hotel will be my choice again should I ever return to San Francisco.

review.title: Great location / expensive parking
review.reviewText: The stay was good , clean rooms, good service and there is a small breakfast restaurant ( open mornings) The location was great close to the warf and great restourants within walking distance. I hated the parking Fee!

review.title: Always good
review.reviewText: Good service and location. Trollies and cable cars are within 5 minute walk

review.title: The best place in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Excelent hotel, tasty pizza in pizzeria in front of hotel )))))

review.title: So close to everything-especailly the Wharf!
review.reviewText: So close to everything-especailly the Wharf!

review.title: Great experience and location
review.reviewText: The hotel is conveniently located to public transportation lines and walking distance to the Wharf's different attractions. The hotel staff was fabulous in providing restaurant recommendations and helping us manage our trip. The rooms were very clean and updated. A great value.

review.title: Great hotel Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel located in Fisherman's whrf. It's so convenient to go anywhere. It's few steps away from bus/train stops. Hotel staff are very helpful.

review.title: One of Best Hotel in Fishermans Wharf Staff were very friendly and nice
review.reviewText: The Hotel needs to at least provide guests with complimentary continental breakfast

review.title: The Only Place I'll Stay in SF
review.reviewText: The Courtyard by Marriot Fishermans Wharf was gorgeous, clean, and in the perfect location. It was just the right distance from Pier 39 and Ghirardelli Square. The staff was welcoming, prepared, and helpful.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Can't beat the location! Would stay here again!

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf
review.reviewText: Great Location, a littly noisy at night, but you are close to everything.

review.title: Great Stay in SF
review.reviewText: Courtyard Marriott made our stay in San Francisco wonderful! The staff was very attentive to our needs! They were polite and helpful. I requested extra shampoo in our room because we had 3 girls and the housekeeper wrote it down, so she would remember! Edward is the concierge and extremely helpful and kind. He makes sure you know where you are going and gives you facts about your destination. I love having access to a computer (in the lobby) to check my flt info and print out my boarding passes. I think once the Anchorage Retail opens, the location will be even more desirable. I definitely would stay in this hotel again!

review.title: Great location, clean and quiet, but lobby was under construction
review.reviewText: Everything was good, but the Lobby was under construction and breakfast got served in front of the elevator on level 3. Breakfast was very marginal but we understand, due to the work in the Hotel.

review.title: excellent location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean and comfortable room (excellent ans spacious beds). The only complaint is that rollaway beds were not available for "double beds room" (???). Breakfast buffet is ok and service is excellent (Lynn was great). Parking is expensive as happened in everyplace in SFO

review.title: Rooms with Elbow Room
review.reviewText: This hotel was conveniently related for all of our "tourist" activities. We had adjoining rooms and for a family of 5 adults, we had ample room to move around without feeling like we were overcrowded. Rooms were clean and the staff was always helpful as far as suggestions, directions and even finding a scale to weigh our luggage.

review.title: Great place to stay!
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco for the first time, and wanted to see all the sights. The Courtyard is in a great location - within walking distance to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, and the Cable Cars. It was clean, safe, and convenient. We would definitely stay again!

review.title: Ready to go back!
review.reviewText: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Staff was very helpful and polite. They even recommended a car service for our commute to/from the airport as well as one for the concert we were attending at AT&T Park. Breakfast was very good and pricing was average. A short walk to the Wharf, Pier 39 etc. It was a great experience and we will return again.

review.title: Well satisfied
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location near Fishermans Wharf , Pier 39. Easy access to city by tram. The only suggestion I would like to make is the hotel fit double glazed windows as sometimes it was noisy outside. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would definitely use this hotel again.

review.title: in the middle of the action
review.reviewText: my husband and I booked two rooms for us and our adult children at this hotel for a three day visit. We loved being only a short walk to the cable car, the Cannery, a nice bakery, and several restaurants as well as Pier 39 shopping area and the wonderful sourdough bread bakery. It was also very easy to ride the electric bus/tram whatever it's called, to other parts of the city. The rooms were clean, the internet easy to access, and the staff friendly. All in all, an excellent stay. I'd stay again.

review.title: Very comfortable and convenient
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with this hotel, I've always had good experiences with Marriott, the beds are extremely comfortable and they furnish different types of pillows as well. My husband and I traveled with our 21 year old son and we needed two beds and they offer queen size not just doubles as most others. Even with the larger beds the room was plenty large enough. The bathroom is large enough so you can change clothes privately. They have refrigerators in each room and we asked for and received a microwave as well. Would gladly stay again and recommend to others as well.

review.title: Good Location & Value
review.reviewText: This hotel was extremely convenient to the Wharf and Ghiradelli Square. We enjoyed the room, although the view of the parking garage next door left something to be desired, especially with all the bright lights. Staff was excellent, and also enjoyed the park 2 blocks away on the water.

review.title: Accessible Hotel
review.reviewText: Impressed with the free internet access. Rooms are clean and newly renovated. Conceirge is very good in welcoming us by giving us maps and welcome pack on SFO. HOtel reception is helpful and staff is friendly. Overall, plesant stay there. Accessible walking distance. Suggestion : Pls have a fridge in the hotel room or provide complimentary breakfast. It will be lovely to wake up and don't have to search for places to eat.

review.title: Nice location
review.reviewText: This is a classic hotel, with a good service. Ideally located, minutes from all commodities (including cable car, buses, and light rail) and the Fisherman's Wharf. The air conditioning was very loud, and so was the street traffic. Windows did not close very well, but all in all, it was quite noisy but still ok. Internet access was free and fast.

review.title: clean and friendly
review.reviewText: i will stay again close to every thing

review.title: Can't wait to go back.
review.reviewText: Went here on the 4th of July with other friends. Had a ok experience checking in, but the overall experience was great. I would go back again anytime and stay here. Perhaps the best part is that the location is excellent. Its right on Jefferson and has wonderful access to every place including the beach, Piers, restaraunts, etc.

review.title: For a Marriott, was a Little Disappointed
review.reviewText: Being a long time Marriott rewards member and spending much time in Marriott's around the world, this Marriott was a little disappointing. One of the two elevators was broken during my stay, which led to delayed lines and waits at the elevator. on top of the elevator issue, they locked all the doors to the stairwell entrances, which forced you to use the elevators. House keeping did not clean my room after the first night. Had to place a call to get someone to clean my room. Parking and breakfast prices were too inflated, and quality of the food was not that great. The people at the front desk and restaurant were nice.

review.title: Great location by Piers and attractions
review.reviewText: We stayed at the Marriott for two days over the 4th of July weekend. They actually let us check in early at 10:30 am as they were not full the night before. The room was very comfortable, a decent size, and the beds were made with luxurious bedding. The best part of this hotel is the location. We did not use our car the entire time we were there as everything is so close by. The only thing that was a hinderance was one of the two elevators was down the entire time we were there. So we ended up doing four flights of stairs rather than wait for the elevator that was always busy.

review.title: Great Staff, Great Beds
review.reviewText: Everything was good but I wish we had a better view from our room. Be sure to ask if it's important to you. All we could see was the wall of a parking garage. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great Location and Staff
review.reviewText: This hotel was perfect for my mom and my mothers day weekend in San Francisco. The location was literally a block from Fisherman's Wharf and tons of souvenier shops. Also we were about 2 blocks from the cable car turnaround. The hotel staff was very very friendly and very accomodating with helping us make reservations for tours and trips in town. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit San Francisco as a tourist. Oh and if you're a baseball fan, definitely take in a Giants game if they're at home.

review.title: Fisherman's Wharf with Kids
review.reviewText: The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating. Concierge was excellent. Restaurant staff incredibly good with kids. Convenient parking. Good tourist location. Some noise issues with people jumping in the room above us. Decent size room for 2 adults and 2 kids.

review.title: Fantastic Trip!
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, and all staff were very helpful! We were there for 6 nights and enjoyed our clean room, and fantastic service. The front desk staff were helpful when it came down to sights to see and things to avoid. We always felt welcomed every time we walked back in after a day of sight seeing! I would stay here again and again.

review.title: close to fishermans wharf
review.reviewText: great location to fishermans wharf but can be loud on the weekends (hear street noise).

review.title: Valued For money
review.reviewText: What can i say? Location, Location, Location! Excellent Location. 2 mins walk to the Historic F train. 5 mins walk to the Cable Car turnaround. 10 mins walk to Pier 39. How much better can it get? Hotel room is comfortabl too! My boyfriend and i really enjoyed our time there.

review.title: Reasonable Comforts
review.reviewText: Service is great and perfect for nightlife

review.title: Walking Distance
review.reviewText: The Courtyard Marriot at Fisherman's Wharf was a delight. It's walking distance to the Wharf as well as Ghiradelli Square. If you want to go to Union Square, it's just a short ride on the Cable Cars which is also nearby.

review.title: very convenient to all attractions. centrally located
review.reviewText: very clean and well run. no complaints. very convenient to all attractions. centrally located

review.title: Highly Recommend
review.reviewText: The hotel was in an excellent location, within walking distance from almost everything a person would want to do in San Francisco. The street car stop was less than a block away. The hotel staff was very friendly and most helpful.

review.title: Thanksgiving Week in San Fran
review.reviewText: The location is easy to find, just a block off of fisherman wharf, and a block from grabbing the street cars. Its about as centrally located as you can get. On arrival the staff was great..thru the whole stay they were wonderful. Room was quiet, perhaps one of the most quiet Ive ever had. Baby next door...if you listened intently you might hear it crying..but otherwise no noise! For families there are several choices for restaurants nearby, along with a few more upscale places as well. Almost everything is within walking distance but the streetcars were nice to take to the places a lil further away.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Good location, clean and comfortable rooms.

review.title: Nice place to stay
review.reviewText: Friendly staff, room very clean. Within walking distance of the wharf. Walgreens just around the corner. Great experience. Hotel room was quiet on the courtyard side. Conciere was very pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Great San Fran Trip
review.reviewText: We thought this hotel was a fine, standard Courtyard property. Just be sure to ask for a room away from the street. The first night we were on the street, and it was really noisy. The breakfast was good, or you can get breakfast at nearby restaurants. We'd never been to SF as tourists before and liked being in the Fisherman's Wharf area.

review.title: I would stay here again.
review.reviewText: Great location and neighborhood for a family. Within walking distance of Fisherman's Wharf attractions and all public transportation including cable cars. Excellent service from hotel staff. Very quiet rooms. Very clean. Breakfast buffet is nothing fancy but provides excellent choices to start off the day such as omelette bar or freshly cooked eggs any way you like them, fresh fruit, pastries, cereal, waffles.

review.title: Marriott Courtyard
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel because of the location. After reading some reviews about the noise level I was a bit hesitant but I had no problems what so ever. We had a beautiful view of the bay and the courtyard (which included an In & Out Burger.. YUM!). The location was absolutely perfect (just a block from the wharf and around the corner from Starbucks and Walgreens. All the comforts of home! I would book this hotel again in a second!

review.title: Just OK
review.reviewText: The room smelled stale when we first walked in. We had to turn on the fan to get circulation going. The Hotel was ok. The staff was very friendly. I was disappointed on the set up with the parking. They utilize the public lot next door. It's very incovenient to stay here if you have a car. Parking is $22 (Validated) per day. You do get in and out priveleges but this garage gets very full due to the tourists. If you have no car, then this hotel is centrally located in Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Tranquility in a busy city!
review.reviewText: Congeniality is the hallmark of the staff. An in-house resteraunt provides a complete, and well prepared variety of breakfast foods, with an excellent brewed house coffee. The hotel's location places all of the usual tourist attractions along Fisherman's Wharf in easy walking distance. Cable car service is minutes away. Will plan to spend our return visit with these friendly folks.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location

review.title: This is the place!
review.reviewText: If you are looking for great location, great service, and a great room, this is the place. Located 1 block from the wharf and 1 block from the end of the Hyde street cable car stop, this is a great starting point for any SF trip.

review.title: Good business friendly hotel
review.reviewText: Stayed 4 nights. Good service and business friendly with free high-speed internet access (wired), work table, etc. Location is great - within one block of wharf; many restaurants and shops nearby. No in-house restaurant but do have a breakfast cafe.

review.title: Great Location, Great Value
review.reviewText: Can't beat the location - Fisherman's Wharf, the Cannery and Ghiradelli Square all near by. Just a couple block walk to the Buena Vista (where 'Irish Coffee' was invented - a must do!).

review.title: Clean and central
review.reviewText: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at Fisherman's Wharf, in part, due to the location of this hotel. The staff was friendly, the rooms were clean, there was a "hotel geusts only back door" leading right onto the wharf area and the hotel sits right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf. You can pretty much walk everywhere you want to go around the wharf area and the buses, cable cars and street cars that can take you everywhere else are all within a short walk also. One posible negative: there is a bit of noise in the evening and into the night due to the location, so if you're a lite sleeper this may not be the place for you.

review.title: Great Hotel!!!!!!
review.reviewText: We were in San Francisco in July and stayed at this hotel for a week. It was very clean and the beds were wonderful. The room was large and the service was great. They were very helpful with maps and directions and suggestions on what to do and where to eat. It was convenient to all transportation and restaurants. I will stay there again on my next trip.

review.title: Location was great
review.reviewText: Location was great and the hotel was clean. The only thing was, the bathroom was a good size but then the toilet was up against the wall. I can't figure that out. Also the tub was very slow to drain and when I reported that, I was just told OK and the two hotel employees just kind of snickered.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: We were very saisfied with their service and their location.

review.title: I'd go again
review.reviewText: Neat clean and close

review.title: Big rooms, great location, decent, but not exceptional
review.reviewText: I know this review is going to sound rather picky, but I've stayed in alot of Courtyards and have generally been universally impressed. This Courtyard has large rooms (for San Francisco anyway, not for Courtyards) with 5 pillows/bed and 3 sheets - VERY nice. The QUEEN beds were great. Great location - 3 blocks from Pier 39 and only about 12 from Chinatown/little Italy. But, as a nit, the bathroom was well below Courtyard standards. The towels were threadbare and small and we only got 1 tiny shampoo bottle for 4 of us (and no lotion, conditioner, or showercaps). Sure, we could've hunted down the staff and gotten more, but we've never had to do that before in a Courtyard. But, overall, it's a nice motel in a great area. The staff is quite nice and helpful. The lobby, while modest is fine (as if anyone really cares about the lobby anyway).

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I would certainly go back

review.title: Good value on the Wharf
review.reviewText: The good news is that you're close to Fisherman's Wharf, and you can easily walk to a number of the tourist sites and restaurants. The bad news is that you're close to Fisherman's Wharf, and if your room is close to the street or sidewalk, then you are bound to hear people heading home from a night on the town. Basically it's a better bet for someone on vacation than on business. The staff was friendly and helpful, and it seemed to be a pretty good value for a good location.

review.title: Best mid-priced hotel.
review.reviewText: This is not a four diamond hotel, but it is clean, quiet, comfortable, has all the little things you need (refrigerator - upon request; iron and ironing board in room, pay movies, small gym, honor bar in lobby and laundry facilities). The rooms are a nice size, for San Fran, beds are a little hard, but comfortable, feather pillows, very good heat/air cond. There is a security guard in the lobby at night, he also walks around the front and to the garage right next door, quite convienant. You come out the front, make a left turn down this alley (well, you shouldn't call it an alley, because there are shops there) and you're right on the warf, fantastic!

review.title: Good hotel, will come back again...
review.reviewText: The hotel is a great place to stay. Close to everything in Fisherman Wharf. I will come back again in the future...

review.title: Gread Location and Great Service!
review.reviewText: I picked this hotel from the Expedia list, based on the location. I was not disappointed. It is located in the perfect place to get to all the sites, eat, and do fun things. It is in the middle of EVERYWHERE. The best part is that there is NO need for a car. The concierge at the hotel was just wonderfu. He always remembered individuals, and went out of his way to make any arranges for the guests that he could. He did everything for us, and our experiences were wonderful.

review.title: Clean and great location
review.reviewText: The hotel is a standard Courtyard Marriott-clean and in good condition. The hotel is in a great location in san fran around the block from Fisherman's wharf and within walking distance of north beach/little italy for good dinners. We had a great time!

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a very nice place

review.title: San francisco good hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel to spend the week end in San Francisco, well located near the bay but no view on the bay. Lacking of room service but very good concierge
